text: Psalm 98
Praise to Yahweh for His Salvation and Judgment
A psalm.\f + \fr Ps 98 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Sing to\f + \fr 98:1 \ft Or “sing concerning” \f* Yahweh a new song, for he has done wonders.
His right hand and his holy arm have secured his victory.
Yahweh has made known his salvation;\f + \fr 98:2 \ft Or “victory” \f*
to the eyes of the nations he has revealed his righteousness.
He has remembered his loyal love and his faithfulness
to the house of Israel.
All \add the\add* ends of the earth have seen
the salvation\f + \fr 98:3 \ft Or “victory” \f* of our God.
Shout joyfully to Yahweh, all the earth.
Be cheerful\f + \fr 98:4 \ft Or “Burst forth” \f* and sing for joy and sing praises.
Sing praises to Yahweh with lyre,
with lyre and melodious sound.
With trumpets and sound of horn,
shout joyfully before the king, Yahweh.
Let the sea with\f + \fr 98:7 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* its fullness roar,
\add the\add* world and those who live in it.
Let \add the\add* rivers clap \add their\add* hands.
Let \add the\add* hills sing joyfully together
before Yahweh, for \add he is\add* coming
to judge the earth.
He will judge \add the\add* world with righteousness
and \add the\add* peoples with equity.
